name: Arch Linux 32
description: The community maintained continuation of 32-bit support for Arch Linux.

name: Arch Linux ARM
description: A distribution of Linux for ARM computers.

name: PacBSD
description: A lightweight and flexible BSD distribution that provides a base system for use of pacman package manager.

name: Arch Hurd
description: A derivative work of Arch Linux porting it to the GNU Hurd system with packages optimised for the i686 architecture.

name: ArchWSL
description: ArchLinux as a WSL Instance.

name: Manjaro
description: A professionally made Linux based operating system that is a suitable replacement for Windows or macOS.

name: ArcoLinux
description: A full-featured distribution.

name: ArchBang Linux
description: A lightweight distribution based on Arch Linux.

name: Archcraft OS
description: A Minimalistic Linux Distribution, Focused On Aesthetics & Based On Arch Linux.

name: Archman
description: An Arch Linux-based distribution which features the Calamares system installer and a pre-configured desktop environment.

name: Bluestar Linux
description: A GNU/Linux distribution that is based on Arch Linux.

name: EndeavourOS
description: A rolling release Linux distribution based on Arch Linux.

name: ArchLabs Linux
description: A distribution based on Arch Linux and featuring the Openbox window manager as the primary desktop interface.

name: Namib GNU/Linux
description: A desktop operating system based on (and compatible with) the Arch Linux distribution.

name: ArchEX
description: A new (190612) Linux live DVD based on Arch Linux. Arch motto is KISS (Keep It Simple Stupid.

name: Arch XFerience
description: A modern OS based on Arch Linux, built for day-to-day operations with tons of packages & features.

name: Ctlos Linux
description: Arch Linux based distro.

name: MagpieOS
description: Get a fresh experience of Arch.

name: Netrunner Rolling
description: Manjaro/Arch Linux based distro.

name: PuppyRus-A
description: Lightweight, portable and flexible Linux based on Arch, Puppy, Porteus.

name: TeLiSc OS
description: A simple GNU/Linux distribution based on Arch Linux which provides you a stable Arch Linux with i3 window manager.

name: Qubes OS (Archlinux Template)
description: A security-focused desktop operating system that aims to provide security through isolation (Unofficial Archlinux Template).

name: BlackArch Linux
description: (Security/Forensics) - An Arch Linux-based distribution designed for penetration testers and security researchers.

name: ArchStrike
description: (Security) - A distribution for security professionals and researchers based on Arch Linux.

name: SystemRescueCd
description: (Data Rescue) - An Arch-based Linux system on a bootable CD-ROM or USB drive, designed for repairing a system and data after a crash.

name: MorpheusArch Linux
description: (Data Rescue) - A distribution based on Arch Linux.

name: LinHES
description: (MythTV) - An attempt to make the installation of GNU/Linux and MythTV as trivial as possible.

name: UBOS
description: (Server) - A Linux distribution designed to greatly reduce the amount of time required to set up and maintain common network services.

name: TalkingArch
description: (Assistive) - A re-spin of the Arch Linux live ISO image, modified to include speech and Braille output for blind and visually-impaired users.

name: Archphile
description: (Raspberry Pi/ARM/Audio) - Yet another linux audio distribution for embedded boards.

name: BBQLinux
description: (Android Developers) - A user-friendly Linux distribution made for Android developers.

name: RaspArch
description: (Raspberry Pi/ARM) - A “remaster” of Arch Linux ARM.

name: Chakra GNU/Linux
description: A user-friendly and powerful distribution and live CD originally forked from Arch Linux.

name: KaOS
description: KaOS is an independent distribution focused on Qt and KDE.

name: Obarun
description: An Arch Linux based distribution featuring the S6 init software in place of systemd.

name: Artix Linux
description: A fork (or continuation as an autonomous project) of the Arch-OpenRC and Manjaro-OpenRC projects.

name: Hyperbola GNU/Linux-libre
description: A community driven effort to provide a fully free (as in freedom) operating system that is stable, secure, simple, lightweight that tries to Keep It Simple Stupid (KISS) with Long Term Support (LTS).

name: Parabola GNU/Linux-libre
description: An unofficial "libre" variant of Arch Linux.

name: Alfheim Linux
description: Systemd free Arch based Linux.

name: Anarchy
description: A simple and intuitive Arch Linux installer.

name: Archfi
description: Just a simple bash script wizard to install Arch Linux after you have booted on the official Arch Linux install media.

name: Auracle (C++)
description: A flexible command line client for Arch Linux's User Repository.

name: pbget (Python)
description: Retrieve PKGBUILDs and local source files from Git, ABS and the AUR for makepkg.

name: repoctl (Go)
description: Make it easy to manage your local Arch Linux repository.

name: yaah (Bash)
description: A helper for the Archlinux User Repository (AUR).

name: Aurutils (Bash)
description: Helper tools for the AUR.

name: Bauerbill (Python)
description: An extension of Powerpill with AUR and ABS support.

name: PKGBUILDer (Python)
description: An AUR helper (and library) in Python 3.

name: repofish (Bash)
description: Simple shell script used to manage a local archlinux repository.

name: RUA (Rust)
description: Build tool for Arch Linux providing control, review and jailed build options.

name: Aura (Haskell)
description: A secure, multilingual package manager for Arch Linux and the AUR.

name: Pacaur (Bash)
description: An AUR helper that minimizes user interaction.

name: Pakku (Nim)
description: pacman wrapper with AUR support.

name: Paru (Rust)
description: AUR helper with all needed modern wrapper features, created by a former developer of yay.

name: pikaur (Python)
description: AUR helper with minimal dependencies. Review PKGBUILDs all in once, next build them all without user interaction.

name: Trizen (Perl)
description: Lightweight AUR Package Manager.

name: Yay (Go)
description: Yet another Yogurt, an AUR Helper written in Go.

name: Argon (Python | GTK3)
description: lightweight GUI package manager for Arch Linux.

name: Cylon (Bash | TUI)
description: A CLI TUI menu driven bash shell script supporting updates, maintenance, backups and system checks for an Arch based Linux distro.

name: Pamac (Vala | GTK3)
description: Graphical Package Manager for Manjaro Linux with Alpm, AUR, Appstream, Flatpak and Snap support.

name: Pakku GUI (Python | GTK3)
description: Basic GTK interface to (install|remove|upgrade) packages with pakku.

name: PkgBrowser (Python | Qt5)
description: A utility for browsing pacman databases and the AUR.

name: Octopi (C++ | Qt5)
description: A graphical user interface for the Arch Linux package management tool pacman.

name: Yup (Go | TUI)
description: Arch Linux AUR Helper with ncurses functionality and better searching and sorting.

name: aur-out-of-date
description: Determines out-of-date AUR packages w.r.t. upstream version.

name: aurpublish
description: PKGBUILD management framework for the Arch User Repository.

name: devtools
description: Tools for the Arch Linux distribution for building and maintaining official repository packages.

name: pkgbuild-watch
description: Alerts you to upstream activity.

name: pkgoutofdate
description: Checks whether Arch packages are out-of-date.

name: arch-audit
description: A utility like pkg-audit based on Arch Security Team data.

name: aur-talk
description: A script to fetch and display AUR package comments.

name: aurvote-utils
description: A set of utilities for managing AUR votes.

name: haskell-aur
description: Haskell library for accessing Aurweb RPC interface.

name: package-query
description: Tool for querying libalpm and the AUR.

name: python3-aur
description: AUR-related modules and helper utilities (aurploader, aurquery, aurtomatic).

name: raur
description: Rust library for accessing Aurweb RPC interface.

name: Dotfiles Generator
description: Dotfiles generator that allows quick configuration of different Window Managers and tools in multiple operating systems, including any Arch Linux-based distribution.

name: Termux Arch
description: Run Arch Linux ARM on your mobile phone with Termux.

name: archlinux/base
description: A docker image based on Arch Linux.

name: Arch Linux on EC2
description: Amazon EC2 AMIs based on Arch Linux
